TweakableStaging can be applied to basically any part that already functions via staging through an MM patch, thus. For stock chutes/, the patch should match HAS[@MODULE[ModuleParachute]], for RealChute useHAS[@MODUL[[RealChuteModule]] and change the pass from FOR[TweakableEverything] to AFTER[RealChute].

I've found a (couple of) bug(s) in TweakableEverything that is quite annoying (to me at least) that breaks staging/fairings on the LV-N atomic engine.

How to reproduce A:

  1. Build a rocket with an LV-N upper stage and a TR-18A decoupler (probably any other decoupler too but this is the one I used).
  2. Launch.
  3. Stage to upper stage.
  4. The stages will separate and the LV-N vill fire, but the shroud will not sepate from the engine.

How to reproduce B:

  1. Build a rocket with an LV-N upper stage and a TR-18A decoupler.
  2. Remove shroud from LV-N engine.
  3. Launch.
  4. Stage to upper stage.
  5. The stage will NOT separate but the LV-N will fire anyway. It is possible to right click on the decoupler to fire it but staging but it cannot be activated by staging.

Tested with:

  • KSP 24.2, 32-bit, clean install
  • Windows 7 Pro, 64-bit
  • TweakableEverything versions 1.3.1 and 1.4

Hope it's solvable as this mod is one of my (many) must-haves. :-)
